projectData.task: To optimize the preparation process of an annual report for a network science lab so that it drives both team engagement and lab brand awareness.
projectData.whyExists: Applied Network Research Lab of the HSE University in Moscow asked me to manage the annual report. For this, I decided to optimize the writing workflow to enable both focus on the contents (and not on the formatting) and content repurposing. To do this, I assembled a framework, set up a technical system and conducted seminars where I onboarded team members to use the system. Please, see the 'Process' section for deteailed explanation of design decisions.
projectData.metaphor: The main idea is 'separation of concerns': text, images, academic references and formatting templates are all separated from each other and then compiled according to a DIY template. Another goal is to write content once and use it both as an inner report and a website. I chose Markdown languauge for writing content, Obsidian as a text editor for its ease of use, Zotero for reference management, Pandoc for document compilation and GitHub actions for automating the final document compilation.

details.title: Discussion
details.text: After ideating, I came up with a possible solution and pitched it to the team. It was not readily accepted as it required some technical know-how, but eventually we settled on this solution.

images.caption: Presentation slide with Obsidian and Zotero apps

details.title: User flow
details.text: After discussion, I built a detailed user flow of the system and shared it with the team. It required me to use the following apps and services: Obsidian, Zotero, Pandoc, GitHub and GitHub Actions. The UX of the process for the user looks like this.

images.caption: The user flow of the collaborative writing pipeline

details.title: Prototype
details.text: With a help of a lab colleague, I wrote a Continuous Integration script for GitHub Actions to automatically compile a final PDF of the report any time a team member adds new piece of text to the repository.
details.longtext: Now all the formatting, bibliography insertions and 'References' sections are done automatically, and team members only need to care about authoring the report in plain text.

images.caption: The CI script for the GitHub Actions

details.title: Seminars
details.text: I held several seminars for the team members with a walktrhough of the process and helped them to make their first 'commit'.
details.longtext: Now we are finally testing the workflow and starting to work on the contents of the report.
